images.caption:
Figure 1:Exemplary electrical circuit with current and voltage
source as well as an ohmic resistor.

Figure 2:Overview of the required components
of AITEE.

Figure 3:Image of a
circuit with netlist nodes.

Figure 6:Output of the object detection for the example circuit with
the YOLOv8s model.

Figure 7:Illustration of the process for recognizing the connection
nodes in an electrical circuit.

Figure 8:Process to calculate normalized graph embeddings using the
netlist graph as well as netlist metadata.

Figure 9:Cosine Similarity Map of Circuit Embeddings. Heat map
showing similarities between circuit embeddings across 8 classes
(2 circuits per class). High similarity values (yellow) appear
between circuits of the same class, with minimal similarity
(black) between different classes, demonstrating the effectiveness
of graph embeddings in distinguishing circuit topologies.

Figure 12:Accuracy by Circuit Class for the given LLM configurations. Stacked bar histogram detailing the accuracy (y-axis) of Llama 3.1 (8B, 70B, 405B) and Claude 3.5 Sonnet models under various problem-solving strategies.
